headline: US electric vehicle tax breaks will expire on Sept. 30
summary: (Reuters) -It is the end of the line for U.S. electric vehicle tax credits.  Sweeping tax and budget legislation approved by Congress on Thursday means $7,500 tax credits for buying or leasing new electric vehicles will end on September 30, as well as a $4,000 used EV credit, that have helped juice green vehicle sales in recent years.  The Electrification Coalition, an EV advocacy group, said on Thursday "as EVs secure a growing share of the global automotive market, it is obvious that the future of transportation is electric; this bill forfeits America’s role in that future to China."
